imdb_user_reviews.contents: Is the vast majority dead wrong?
Exactly what it should have been, yet cruelly underrated.
Oh come on; this is Mel Brooks inspired.....
Not nearly as bad as everyone seems to think
Brilliant Biblical Send-up: Smart and Funny
There's not very many horribly bad moments, but at the same time, there's very few funny moments.
A laugh-filled review of ancient history: grass shacks to gilded palaces in 97 minutes
Yeah it sucks, but in a funny way.
A major misfire from all concerned
Jack black is...  the same character he ALWAYS plays.
A dull comedy of biblical proportions
The most funny movie in a long time
Harold Ramis Introduces Us To The Funy Side Of History
A good laugh, as long as you don't take it too seriously
If you're looking for Superbad, don't look here.
Could this be one of the worst "comedies" of all time? Why yes, yes it can!
More Meat than Meets the Eye
Mildly fun, but very few big laughs.
Banish this back to the stone age.
In Year One Ramis Made Caddyshack.
If a comedy has no laughs, is it still a comedy?
Why must so many comedies these days fail to do what they are supposed to ?
Holy Moly: not that good, but not that bad
One of the Most Quotable Movies Ever
Unfunny on the whole, but it does look good
A very unsatisfactory Biblical spoof which wears out long before it's over
Not sure why people didn't like it
Its silly,crazy,stupid BUT well made  idiotic fun.
turns out its not that bad
It's Not Great But It's OK
The sick humor is what makes this movie great!
I had pains in my cheeks by half way, the jokes were hurting my face.
Let's hope there's no Year Two
There must be something better somewhere on TV
Not the greatest story ever told
What can I say? I liked it.
funny movie which doesn't make you laugh!
Year One is not bad, but it could have been better
There is one word to describe this film and that it rubbish
Actually pretty funny if you ignore the errors
The first thousand years of Biblical history is witty
Not Much More to it than the Preview
Which one year were they referring to?
Blasphemy and Atheistic world view poorly disguised as comedy....
Oliver Platt is the only reason to see this
One might best think of it as an update to "Caveman" and "The History of the World, Part 1" with all the good gags taken out.
Fantastic movie, but not for everyone!
I wanted to like it, to love it... but I simply could not
A comedy for 12 years olds....and even they weren't laughing
A movie about Neanderthals for Neanderthals by Neanderthals.
Quite simply, one of the most boring movies I have ever seen.
One of the worsts movies ever made
Just miss beginning of the world comedy...
Year One? Plays more like 500 BCE.
Not as funny as I thought
Not that dumb of a movie
Dumb, dumb, dumb... occasionally funny but falls flat.
Hilarious - but why the gay jokes?
We were almost the only ones in the theater.  Seriously.
I don't understand the negative feedback people give this film 0_o
Awful movie, if you seen the trailer you basically saw all the jokes and the jokes aren't even funny in the trailer
I wanted it to be good. I really did.
A completely unfunny waste of time and talent
Too many perverted jokes and not enough comedy!
The Most Atrocious Piece of Crap I Have Seen in the Last Few Years
Wasted Talent and then there's Jack Black
Hard to believe Harold Ramis directed this.
Yeah, it's as bad as people say.
Year One is painfully awful... I'm not kidding, this movie physically hurt!
To bad they can't go lower than 1
Not What I Was Hoping For But Still Well Worth Giving A Chance.
Not your father's Old Testament (PS--Paul Rudd was Abel)
Just a bigger-budgeted and *slightly* better quality version of "Meet The Spartans". The only comedy that made me depressed walking out of the cinema.
not as Hilarious as it was expected out of the promos
First comedy I have ever seen that was completely silent for the duration.
Only gave it a one because IMDb doesn't have a zero
Utter Utter Utter Utter Utter Utter Garbage
terribly unfunny, pointless, disrespectful, and lame
One of the worst films of the decade.
Absolutely Awful- May be worst movie EVER
Never thought it is possible, but it is dumber than "White Chicks".
With its stars and director this is one of the biggest upsets in comedy
Not the most amazing comedy ever, but it provides chuckles.
Year One Movie Review from The Massie Twins
Senseless humor that should have been sacrificed to the blazing inferno

mc_user_reviews.text: I rated this movie the total number of times I snickered throughout its entire 97 minutes. It really boils down to the fact that Jack Black and Michael Cera are a bad combo; combine that with the movie's lackluster writing and you get "Year One."

I actually felt my I.Q. level fall at least a few points after this idiot-fest was over. I can also thank this movie for single-handedly destroying my respect for every actor in it, especially the two leads. Paul Rudd, how could you?

I really don't understand the low rating because I absolutely loved this movie. I've watched it several times and could keep on watching it again and again. I wasn't a Jack Black fan before seeing this, but now I'm more interested in seeing his movies. Michael Cera was terrific, as one might expect.

It was kind of funny, but it was also full of gross, unnecessary dialogue. Overall, it was O.K., but I am giving it a 3 out of disgust. One of Jack Black, the #1 comedian in the world's weakest movies.

Ummmm... What can I say about this movie? It has disapointed me more then all the past god of war knock-off movies combined. As a christian I am thouroughly offended by the jokes and during the entire film there were bladenly obvious and unclever sexual references and jokes. I'm all for them if there clever and funny (arrested development for example) but I almost hated sopmorical humor after watching this piece of s***. I am not even kidding one of my friends I was watching this with just walked out and I discussed with my other friend wether we should join him or not and now I wish I did. I am not even kidding when I say that I double dipped with my two friends to watch the new (now old) star trek and felt no shame as year one was worth getting paid to watch.

Very funny, with jokes very well done, this is really an example of "do not trust blindly in the critical", it is worth watching and be sure the writers had a lot of work on the jokes, because they are perfect! To give a low grade for jokes so good, one must be very boring, and is running with all work very well executed! In short: It's worth seeing, and give a good grade, to show these critics  that they are jerks!

I had very low expectations about this movie since Jack Black has made some real duds (be kind, rewind, Nacho Libre, etc)  but I was very surprised to find myself laughing out load at times and overall I enjoyed this movie very much. The plot is simplistic but the comedy is very witty and fresh.Cera's character is great and his rumblings and lines are witty and funny, there were several surprise cameo appearance's also, one of the funnier ones involves Paul Rudd who I really enjoy. This movie is not a 10 but is definitely worth seeing if you like funny movies because the vast majority of them are stinkers, I have recommended this movie to several friends and all have said the same thing after watching it, they thought that it was very funny.

This is one of those movies that you will love or hate. I actually enjoyed this flick. Sure the plot is horrible, dont make much sense. Pointless action scenes, acting isnt that its terrible its just a random movie, on a quest  or lack off. If you like the cast then its worth a watch. If you like cornball movies this is for you. I love cornball movies as its my sense of humor.
Year one is barely sporadically funny, predictabally lame, but the film does offer some rather surprising gross out gags, that some if not most summer comedy fans will enjoy

Awful movie. Jack Black just isn't funny.  He has had one decent movie in the school of rock, and he has been riding that movie to bust after bust after bust. Cera never has been good. I have seen actors playing in high school plays perform better. I watched about 10 minutes of this movie. It had no plot, no character development, and was relying on the pre-teen/teen crowd to carry the ratings.

Bought this on whim having missed it's release. After the opening scene, thought I was on to a winner, however the rest of the film failed to live up to the early promise. There are a few laughs to be had but generally it just isn't funny. The plot is far from smooth and most of the time it appears the actors are making the lines up as they go along.
It was funny throughout. This parody movie has laughs and a bit of a heart. The story was much better than I had expected it to be.

I hate Jack Black! He is a talentless hack who babels on an on like a buffoon. I really have no idea why I wanted to see this horrible piece of cinema, but it's clearly one of the worst movies I've seen all year. The babbling is endless, the characters are whiny, and the plot of the movie is just stupid. I was kind of a hoping a dinosaur would come along and eat these two idiots! This is two hours of my life I wish I could have back.
It was very funny I loved this movie..    .
The last half hour of Year One is much better than the first hour but is still very stupid, childish and I expected Adam Sandler to turn up any second.

A very mis-matched movie, it mixes humor seen in bad cartoons with adult sex references. The movie has some great actors in tow but none really do anything laugh-worthy. The movie goes nowhere for a large portion and makes no good use of the actors comedic talents. I watched it all the way through but took away nothing but the fact the movie was below average at best.

There are few movies I can watch over and over. The Matrix, LotR - The Fellowship of the Ring, The Hobbit and I've recently added Year One to this short list. The first time I saw it, I think there was just too much to take in. It's crammed with jokes and subtle body language. If you're stuck up or don't like outrageous humor like Dumb and Dumber, don't bother. I don't feel like reading another "Woe is me,  this movie is so disgusting/offensive/gross". Go back to your Downton Abbey.

Do you really think a movie written and directed by Harold Ramis (Animal House, Caddyshack, Stripes, Ghostbusters, Groundhog Day) could be that bad? It's the kind of movie that critics love to hate, which is why critics suck.

In " Year One " truly this very forgotten , as those two characters not estabanen Bible and believed that the script and reality is changed, rather horrible a movie , in terms of plot, script and acting of the cast.
'Year One' wants to be seen as a freeform, knockabout trawl through Biblical history, perfect for an undemanding Saturday night.
